issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
Created a sec group "test" (shown below) while running 3.0.2, verified use of this group by running and use an instance within it. Terminated the instance, and upgraded the system to 3.1. Once running 3.1 I could no longer use this security group "test", however I could create a new security group with the same attributes and run instances with the new one. 


{code}
euca-describe-group
GROUP	051419382097	test	test
PERMISSION	051419382097	test	ALLOWS	udp	0	0	FROM	CIDR	0.0.0.0/0
PERMISSION	051419382097	test	ALLOWS	tcp	0	0	FROM	CIDR	0.0.0.0/0
PERMISSION	051419382097	test	ALLOWS	icmp	0	0	FROM	CIDR	0.0.0.0/0
GROUP	051419382097	default	default group
{code}

#Could not run instances within the group...
{code}
[root@eucahost-51-67 ~]# tail -f /var/log/eucalyptus/cloud-output.log &
[root@eucahost-51-67 ~]# euca-run-instances -g test emi-C35C361C

fields.summary: Can not use pre-existing sec groups post 3.0.2 to 3.1 upgrade
fields.environment:
Installed Packages
Name       : eucalyptus
Arch       : x86_64
Version    : 3.1.0
Release    : 0.0.2681.20120613git301bc89a.21.el5

192.168.51.67	CENTOS	5.8	64	REPO	[CLC]
192.168.51.68	CENTOS	5.8	64	REPO	[WS]
192.168.51.79	CENTOS	5.8	64	REPO	[CC00 SC00]
192.168.51.83	CENTOS	5.8	64	REPO	[NC00]

comments.body:
I found the problem here.  cloud-error.log shows the failed SQL update:

{noformat}
Caused by: java.sql.BatchUpdateException: Batch entry 0 insert into metadata_network_indices
(creation_timestamp, last_update_timestamp, metadata_perm_uuid, version, 
metadata_display_name, metadata_last_state, metadata_state, metadata_state_change_stack, 
metadata_account_name, metadata_account_id, metadata_unique_name, metadata_user_id, 
metadata_user_name, metadata_network_index_bogus_id, metadata_network_index_extant_network_fk, 
metadata_network_index, id) values ('2012-06-13 05:19:18.783000 -07:00:00', '2012-06-13 
05:19:18.783000 -07:00:00', '26db8d02-c001-4f44-9a32-ceb9284cef46', '0', '76:21', 'FREE', 
'FREE', 'n/a', NULL, '051419382097', '051419382097:76:21', '9CVDI629RUP4ZWHO1F6OH', 'admin', 
'76:21', '4028b3c337e457b60137e5c89c79003a', '21', '4028b3c337e457b60137e5c89c7f003b')
{noformat}

the actual error if you run this in psql is:

{noformat}
ERROR:  insert or update on table "metadata_network_indices" violates foreign key constraint
 "fkbdc151865dab4005"
DETAIL:  Key (metadata_network_index_extant_network_fk)=(4028b3c337e457b60137e5c89c79003a) is 
not present in table "metadata_extant_network".
{noformat}

One of the patches that I committed yesterday was to deal with migrating the network state in the metadata_extant_network table correctly.  The result is that there's already an entry for this security group in that table, and I found that deleting that entry works around the problem.
I don't know whether there's something I'm still missing from the old db, or if I just should be preserving the data from that table.  I suspect it's the former, but I need to do some investigation.

I have a patch for this that appears to work, but I want to talk to [~decker] before committing to make sure there aren't any other issues with preserving extant networks.  The alternative (I think) would be to simply omit this table from the upgrade entirely, since recreating networks is not a big deal.
Discussing with Chris, and agreed that it's better to simply not preserve extant networks at all.
Was able to launch into pre-existing sec groups post fix.
